name: 'Star Trek': Who's Spock Talking To? Quiz | Television | 15 Questions

questions.text: Mr. (name omitted), there was no deity involved. It was my cross-circuiting to B that recovered them.
questions.explanation:
Scott.

	TOS ep 'Obsession'. Said after they were having difficulties beaming Kirk and Ensign Garrovick back up after they set off a bomb.

questions.text: My congratulations, (title omitted). A dazzling display of logic.
questions.explanation:
Captain Kirk.

	Kirk replies jokingly, 'You didn't think I had it in me, did you, Spock?'. Spock deadpans his answer, 'No, sir.' This was from the episode 'The Changeling'.  Spock was referring to the statements Kirk had made to the corrupted Nomad probe, causing it to self-destruct because it was 'in error' and must be 'sterilized'.

questions.text: Logic is a little tweeting bird, chirping in a meadow. Logic is a wreath of pretty flowers which smell BAD. Are you sure your circuits are functioning correctly? Your ears are green.
questions.explanation:
Norman the Android.

	Trying to confuse his logic circuits in TOS ep 'I, Mudd'.

questions.text: Logic, logic, logic. Logic is the beginning of wisdom, (name omitted), not the end.
questions.explanation:
Valeris.

	in 'Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country'.

questions.text: They like you very much, but they are not the hell 'your' whales.
questions.explanation:
Gillian.

	In 'Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home', after he mind-melds with Gracie the whale.

questions.text: Were I to invoke logic, however, logic clearly dictates that the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few.
questions.explanation:
Kirk.

	in 'Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan'.

questions.text: (after being charged with lying.) I exaggerated.
questions.explanation:
Saavik.

	in 'Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan'.

questions.text: I never took the Kobayashi Maru test until now. What do you think of my solution?
questions.explanation:
Kirk.

	in 'Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan', as he's dying in Engineering.

questions.text: Each of us, at some time in our lives, turns to someone - a father, a brother, a God - and asks, 'Why am I here? What was I meant to be?'
questions.explanation:
McCoy.

	in 'Star Trek: The Motion Picture'.

questions.text: While there was a chance, I was bound legally and morally to ascertain the Captain's status.
Your tricorder readings are totally inefficient!
questions.explanation:
Chekov.

	TOS ep 'The Apple'. He and Chekov were creating a distraction while Kirk snuck up on the native of Gamma Trianguli VI named Akuta.

Kirk.

	In STIV:TVH, when Kirk said 'If we play our cards right, we may be able to find out when those whales are being released.'

Sarek.

	To his father, after his operation in TOS ep 'Journey to Babel', asking why he'd marry such an emotional woman. 'At the time, it seemed the logical thing to do,' was Sarek's reply. (Although Vulcan's profess a complete supression of emotions, it certainly sounded like they were poking fun at Amanda.)

questions.text: Weren't those a gift from Dr. McCoy?
questions.explanation:
Kirk.

	in STIV:TVH, as Kirk is selling his antique reading glasses to a 20th century pawn dealer.

questions.text: (Name omitted), if the Enterprise responds to hails and returns to Starbase, there is a good chance that we will never see Captain Kirk or Doctor McCoy alive again.
questions.explanation:
Scott.

	In STVI:TUC, when he's trying to get Scott to 'play along' and create an excuse for the Enterprise-A not to return to starbase.
